title: Charly Cox: 'Writing for social media doesn't make me a bad poet'
text:
Charly Cox has some advice for anyone who claims to be struggling with that most 21st century of conditions, ‘digital burnout’. It’s a novel solution, so brace yourself… “Just turn off your phone.” It might sound obvious, but it’s less so when you consider the prescription comes from a 24-year-old ‘Insta-poet’ who wrote her latest book on her phone and has over 60,000 followers on Twitter and Instagram.

“Just have a serious conversation with yourself and ask: ‘Is this making me unhappy?’ Then stop doing it. It’s like a bad boyfriend. Just dump him,” she says.

Cox is nothing if not direct. Our conversation, in a north London pub at the end of the street where she grew up, spans from old boyfriends...
